meanings.definition: Paying close attention or heed; observant
meanings.sent1: The attentive student listened carefully to the teacher's instructions.
meanings.sent2: She was very attentive during the meeting, taking notes and asking questions.
meanings.sent3: The attentive waiter made sure to refill everyone's water glasses promptly.
meanings.sent4: His attentive gaze never wavered from the speaker, absorbing every word.
meanings.sent5: The attentive squirrel quickly spotted the hidden acorn in the grass.

meanings.definition: Diligent in application or pursuit; constant, steady, persevering
meanings.sent1: The attentive worker always completed tasks on time with great care.
meanings.sent2: She showed an attentive attitude towards her studies, never giving up.
meanings.sent3: The attentive gardener patiently nurtured the delicate flowers to bloom beautifully.
meanings.sent4: His attentive efforts in training paid off when he won the race.
meanings.sent5: The attentive ant tirelessly carried food back to its nest.

meanings.definition: Heedful of the comfort of others; courteous, polite
meanings.sent1: The attentive host made sure all guests felt welcome and comfortable.
meanings.sent2: She was always attentive to her friends' needs, offering help whenever she could.
meanings.sent3: The attentive neighbor baked cookies for everyone on the street as a kind gesture.
meanings.sent4: His attentive manners impressed everyone at the dinner party.
meanings.sent5: The attentive nurse gently reassured the worried patient.
